jurisdiction.name: Indiana
jurisdiction.transparency_law: Indiana Access to Public Records Act (APRA)

validation_metadata.verification_method: Direct review of IC 5-14-3-1 et seq.

rights_of_access.description: All persons are entitled to full and complete information regarding the affairs of government and the official acts of public officials and employees. Legislature declared government is the servant of the people, not their master. All records are presumed open to inspection and copying.
rights_of_access.conditions: Applies to all persons; strong presumption of openness; government serves people philosophy
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Fundamental democratic principle - government serves people, requiring transparency; explicit presumption places burden on government to justify withholding
rights_of_access.request_tips: Assert: 'IC 5-14-3-1 declares all persons entitled to complete information about government. Government is the servant of the people. Please provide [records] under this statutory presumption.'

rights_of_access.description: Requests can be made orally or in writing. No specific form required. This reduces barriers to access and allows informal requests.
rights_of_access.conditions: Oral or written requests both accepted; must reasonably describe records; no purpose statement required; no residency requirement
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Unique flexibility - oral requests permitted for simple matters; reduces formality barriers; still must adequately describe records sought
rights_of_access.request_tips: For simple requests: 'IC 5-14-3-3 permits oral requests. I orally request [simple record description]. Please confirm you will process this oral request.'

rights_of_access.description: For in-person or phone requests, agencies must acknowledge within 24 hours. For mail, fax, or email requests, must acknowledge within 7 days.
rights_of_access.conditions: 24 hours for in-person/phone; 7 days for written requests; acknowledgment confirms receipt and provides timeline estimate
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Fast acknowledgment requirement ensures requests not lost; creates accountability for timely processing
rights_of_access.request_tips: Follow up: 'IC 5-14-3-3 requires acknowledgment within [24 hours/7 days depending on method]. Please confirm receipt and estimated production date.'

rights_of_access.description: After acknowledgment, agencies must provide records within 'reasonable time'. Reasonableness depends on agency size, request size, pending requests, complexity, and operational considerations.
rights_of_access.conditions: Flexible standard based on circumstances; no fixed deadline; considers practicalities; must be objectively reasonable
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Context-dependent standard allows flexibility but requires genuine reasonableness; unreasonable delays can be challenged; small simple requests should be fast
rights_of_access.request_tips: Assert reasonableness: 'IC 5-14-3-3 requires production within reasonable time. Given [simple nature/small size] of this request, production within [specific timeframe] is reasonable. Please confirm.'

rights_of_access.description: Indiana Public Access Counselor provides advisory opinions on public access laws, education, and guidance. Appointed by Governor for 4-year term.
rights_of_access.conditions: Advisory opinions only (not binding); provides expert guidance; free resource for requesters and agencies
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: PAC provides accessible expert guidance; while opinions not binding, they carry significant persuasive weight; helps resolve disputes informally
rights_of_access.request_tips: Seek guidance: 'I may consult the Public Access Counselor under IC 5-14-4 for an advisory opinion on this matter. Please reconsider to avoid PAC involvement.'

rights_of_access.description: Aggrieved parties may file lawsuit in court of competent jurisdiction for injunctive or declaratory relief. Attorney's fees available in some circumstances.
rights_of_access.conditions: File in court of competent jurisdiction; seek injunctive/declaratory relief; attorney fees discretionary
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Judicial remedy available; attorney fees provision helps offset litigation costs for meritorious cases
rights_of_access.request_tips: Warn of litigation: 'IC 5-14-3-9 provides for judicial review with potential attorney fees. I am prepared to pursue this remedy if you do not provide lawful access.'

rights_of_access.description: Agencies must separate and withhold only confidential portions of records. Non-confidential portions must be disclosed.
rights_of_access.conditions: Mandatory segregation; cannot withhold entire document when portions are public; must perform redaction analysis
rights_of_access.applies_to: Records containing both public and exempt information
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Prevents overbroad withholding; agencies must carefully review each record to identify truly exempt portions
rights_of_access.request_tips: Assert segregability: 'IC 5-14-3-6 requires you to separate confidential from non-confidential portions. Please produce all non-confidential portions with only specific exempt information redacted.'
